metadata.title: CVE-2019-6110 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description: In OpenSSH 7.9, due to accepting and displaying arbitrary stderr outputfrom the server, a malicious server (or Man-in-The-Middle attacker) canmanipulate the client output, for example to use ANSI control codes to hideadditional files being transferred.

criterions.comment: openssh: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
